page.title: 20Growth of Tourism
page.content: In the 1920s,the few visitors there were used to stay at the Ship Hotel, either of 2 farms,or self cater in a few wooden huts left from the first world war.In the 1930s a few caravans were sited near the sea and several bungalows built down Sea Lane.In 1936, Butlin's Camp opened but soon closed due to the war.On the beaches metal stakes were placed along with barbed wire.At the top of Sea Lane there was a large gun pointing out to sea. Now Ingoldmells had few visitors,as the many strangers were members of the Armed Forces stationed in the area. In 1946 Butlin's re-opened and there was a gradual increase in the number of caravans and chalets,but it was not until after the 1953 Floods that caravan sites were really expanded. Today they can cater for up to 800 vans with many amenities available.
